rule: If the given word's part of speech can be determined and aligns with one of the part-of-speech tags in the alphabetical list provided, the output must be exactly one of those part-of-speech tags written in uppercase without any additional characters, spaces, or punctuation.
input: sentence: The book is on the shelf., word: book
validityText:
The input provides a sentence and a word. The sentence "The book is on the shelf." is grammatically valid and doesn't contain unusual symbols. The word "book" is present as a substring within the sentence. The word "book" does not include any punctuation. Thus, the input complies with all the rules outlined in the specification.

OK
coverageEvalText:
The chatbot output consists of a single word, "NOUN", which could be a valid part-of-speech tag according to the provided description. The description allows for returning a part-of-speech tag, and "NOUN" aligns with the provided list (NN, NNS, NNP, NNPS). It complies with the requested format of returning only the tag.
OK
